chapterTitle: Introduction to Valuation:The Time Value of Money

columns.text: Here we are evaluating the ethical implications of a deceptive advertisement.  A company offers $100 if you go and try their product. However, in the fine print, they mention that these $100 will be paid in 25 years. We need to answer if this were unethical if they would have advertised this without the disclaimer.

We know the following values: 

|Promotion||
|--|--|
Future Value of the offer| $100
Discount rate per year| 10%
Years until payment| 25

First, we need to understand the Present Value  (PV) of this promotion. For that, we are going to use the PV formula to calculate its worth in today's value. 

$$ PV = \frac{FV}{(1+r)^t}$$

*Where:*
- FV is the future value
- r is the applied rate
- t is the periods of time the rate is applied

Know we can calculate the value. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
PV &= \frac{\$100 }{(1+0.1)^{25}} \\
\\
& = \boxed{\$9.23}
\end{aligned}$$

The $100 promotion is worth **$9.23** today.

We can say that is unethical to advertise this promotion without the disclaimer because of the lockup period of the funds. For the time you get to redeem the offer, it will be worth 9.23% of the promised value. 

On another note, it is always unethical to hide relevant information from a user regardless of the activity.
